title: a script and a modern sans serif - Scene, ??? {Geoff, ???}
content:
Hi Forum.

I would like to identify two fonts I saw in a publication.  
The first (sample 1) is a handwriting Script.  
The second (sample 2) is a modern Sans Serif. I know this one but can't remember the name or Foundry.

Thank's

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sample1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307112215/http:/typophile.com/files/sample1_0.jpg) | 72.71 KB |
| [sample2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307112215/http:/typophile.com/files/sample2_0.jpg) | 73.02 KB |
author: jrsilva

comments.content:
Maybe the first is something by veer

not proxima nova for the second... not whitney either

The sans is [Scene](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307112215/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.116815.1.1&attributes.sampleSize=96&sampleText=espirto&sampleSize=96) by Sebastian Lester.

And I'm not sure if the handwritten script is a commercial font, these are pretty easy to make.

But I could be wrong, I don't really know many script faces.

Geoff\> Glad you got that one! I was trying to think but that one slipped.

Mikey

Thank's Geoff Riding :)  
That's the one.

AS for the Script, I'll keap searching.

I thought maybe the script looked like some of Ronna Penner's scripts, but it's not an exact match to any I found. [Sweet Pea](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307112215/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typadelic/sweet-pea/) is fairly similar, but that's the most I can say about it. A few of her others also resemble it a bit.

I also looked at Rob Leuschke's work, but nothing was very close.

Seeing the language used, this could be from a Scandinavian font designer -- an area we don't see enough of to know very well, speaking for myself.

If someone does ID it, I would like to add it to the Script Font ID Guide.

- Mike Yanega

\> _Seeing the language used, this could be from a Scandinavian font designer_

I think it's Portuguese. Nice script indeed, but maybe custom or proprietary. The line quality is nice and rough.

Ooops! My bad on that. I'm sure you're probably right. Don't know many Portuguese font lettering artists either, I'm afraid.

- Mike Yanega
